info.title: Shopify Admin API
info.description: The REST Admin API lets you build apps and other integrations for the Shopify admin.

get.summary: Retrieves a list of products. Note: As of version 2019-07, this endpoint implements pagination by using links that are provided in the response header. Sending the page parameter will return an error. To learn more, see Making requests to paginated REST Admin API endpoints.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Return only products specified by a comma-separated list of product IDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description:
Return up to this many results per page.
                  (default: 50, maximum: 250)

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Restrict results to after the specified ID.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description:
Return products by their status.
                  (default: active)
                    
                        active: Show only active products.
                        archived: Show only archived products.
                        draft: Show only draft products.

parameters.name: collection_id
parameters.description: Filter results by product collection ID.

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show products last updated after date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show products last updated before date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: published_status
parameters.description:
Return products by their published status
                  (default: any)
                    
                        published: Show only published products.
                        unpublished: Show only unpublished products.
                        any: Show all products.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Show only certain fields, specified by a comma-separated list of field names.

parameters.name: presentment_currencies
parameters.description: Return presentment prices in only certain currencies, specified by a comma-separated list of ISO 4217 currency codes.

example1.summary: Create a new product with the default product variant

example4.summary: Create a new product with multiple product variants

example5.summary: Create a new product with multiple product variants and multiple options

example6.summary: Create a new product with the default variant and base64 encoded image

example7.summary: Create a new product with the default variant and a product image that will be downloaded by Shopify

example8.summary: Creating a product without a title will return an error

example9.summary: Create a product with a metafield

post.summary:
Creates a new product.
          If you want to set the product's SEO information, then you can use the following properties:
          
            metafields_global_title_tag: The name of the product used for SEO purposes. Generally added to the <meta name='title'> tag.
            metafields_global_description_tag: A description of the product used for SEO purposes. Generally added to the <meta name='description'> tag.

parameters.name: updated_at_min
parameters.description: Show products last updated after date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: updated_at_max
parameters.description: Show products last updated before date. (format: 2014-04-25T16:15:47-04:00)

parameters.name: published_status
parameters.description:
Return products by their published status
                  (default: any)
                    
                        published: Show only published products.
                        unpublished: Show only unpublished products.
                        any: Show all products.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to include in the response.

example4.summary: Update a product by clearing product images

example5.summary: Update a product by adding a new product image

example6.summary: Update a product by reordering product image

example7.summary: Update a product by reordering the product variants

example8.summary: Update a product and one of its variants

example9.summary: Update a product's SEO title and description

example10.summary: Show a hidden product by changing the published attribute to true

example11.summary: Hide a published product by changing the published attribute to false

example12.summary: Add a metafield to an existing product

put.summary:
Updates a product and its variants and images.
          If you want to update the product's SEO information, then you can use the following properties:
          
            metafields_global_title_tag: The name of the product used for SEO purposes. Generally added to the <meta name='title'> tag.
            metafields_global_description_tag: A description of the product used for SEO purposes. Generally added to the <meta name='description'> tag.
